alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 09 at 10:07AM CST until February 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Heavy Snow in Grant County...Elsewhere Snow Totals were Reduced... Heavy snow has been fast to accumulate in southern parts of Grant County with reports of greater than 1 inch per hour snowfall rates. With precipitation onset type of rain, slushy, slippery roads have also been reported. Low level dry air entrained from the northeast has limited northerly impacts of precipitation. Forcing and increased snowfall rates expected to slowly pivot east into the afternoon. Previous headlines remain applicable, therefore will be kept in place until further updates. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Grant County. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
